text: Stigmella phyllanthina is a moth of the family Nepticulidae. It is only known from the south-eastern coast of New South Wales, Australia. The wingspan is 3.8-4.6 mm for males. The larvae feed on Glochidion ferdinandi. They mine the leaves of their host plant. The mine consists of a long broad sinuate gallery. The cocoon is white. ==External links== *Australian Faunal Directory *Australian Nepticulidae (Lepidoptera): Redescription of the named species Category:Nepticulidae Category:Moths of Australia
title: Stigmella phyllanthina
